sub_title: Creative Director at Strengholt Music Group
summary: Specialties: Artist & Repertoire, creative management, music publishing, licensing, marketing, concept development, artist management, legal & business affairs.

profile_positions.description:
Strengholt Music Group represents and manages the music rights of creative souls all over the world whether it’s used in singles, compilations and albums, movies, commercials, TV shows and series, video games, mobile platforms and other digital environments. In addition to managing copyrighted works, Strengholt Music Group is well positioned to advise songwriters and composers in additional disciplines including marketing, planning, career forecasts, social media activities and negotiating and closing master and artist deals, licensing agreements and recording contracts.

In my role as Creative Director, I’m in charge of the Front Office where I lead a group of creative managers, legals and the social media department. My responsibilities are basically everything that has to do with the creation and exploitation of copyright and may be summarized as: A&R and creative guidance, new signings in regards to songwriters, composers, artists and catalogues, initiating co-writes, organising writing camps, undertaking all negotiations and legal matters in regards to copyrights, master rights and neighbouring rights and providing for forecasts for both the company’s roster as well as the company itself.
profile_positions.title: Creative Director

profile_positions.description:
Self-owned full service PR/marketing company Ruling Media, specialized in finding tailor made marketing solutions for music related brands, was established in the era when dance music/EDM massively emerged in the USA and became mainstream. I noticed that especially major record companies lacked the knowhow and staff to market dance related music. Ruling Media filled that gap and took care of the entire DJ and radio promotion for dance related releases of the majors, and consulted/advised the major’s VP’s of A&R in regards to new signings.

Ruling Media has worked with repertoire from the likes of David Guetta, Calvin Harris, Swedish House Mafia, Tiësto, Ferry Corsten, Dave Clarke, Deadmau5, Daft Punk, Robbie Rivera and many more, and promoted dance remixes for global pop/urban artists such as Katy Perry, Coldplay, Snoop Dogg, Tinie Tempah, Kylie Minogue, Aretha Franklin, Depeche Mode and others.

The company's client roster consists of Warner Music, Universal Music, Sony Music, (former) EMI Music, Blackhole Recordings, Ministry of Sound, Pacha, F*** Me I'm Famous (by David Guetta), Flashover Recordings (by Ferry Corsten), Pacha, Art Of Dance and many more.

Ruling Media still exists till this date, albeit dormant.
profile_positions.title: Owner / Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
Powerhouse Music, established in June 2013, is the dance division of Dutch media & entertainment company Talpa Media Group (globally acclaimed for developing successful TV formats such as the talent show The Voice) and operates as the sister label of the infamous Dutch pop label 8Ball Music.

Powerhouse Music’s incentive was to discover, sign and release cross-over dance music, (further) develop the music careers of producers and artists and connect music with globally acclaimed brands. With Talpa Media Group as the mother ship, Powerhouse Music offered a strong variety of platforms to promote and exploit dance repertoire and its artists which includes radio, TV, press and media, and publishing. In my position as General Manager, I led a team of product managers, social media managers, radio promotors and assistants. 

In less than two years, Powerhouse Music added successful releases to its catalogue by a.o. Tiësto, Steve Aoki, Eva Simons, Blasterjaxx, Fedde Le Grand, Chocolate Puma, Laidback Luke, Chris Lake, John Dahlbäck, Basto and many more. Powerhouse Music has gathered multiple golden, platinum and double-platinum awards for its releases (both national and international), scored many Radio 538 Dance Smash and Alarmschijf singles and enjoyed top chart positions globally.
profile_positions.title: General Manager

profile_positions.description:
Self owned independent dance music label Selekted Music and sublabels Dirty Dutch Music (set up with DJ Chuckie) and Beat Dis (set up with Real El Canario) were established to cater the global music industry with a diversity of dance music by artists such as Chuckie, Afrojack, Robin S, Sunnery James & Ryan Marciano, R3hab, Glowinthedark, Marco V and many more.

The company mainly focussed on the international exploitation of its releases and the development of the international careers of its artists. Selekted Music experienced its finest hour with the debut releases of current global superstar Afrojack, and with the release of Chuckie's worldwide hit record Let The Bass Kick / Let The Bass Kick in Miami B*tch (with LMFAO), which catapulted Chuckie's career and transformed him from a local DJ into a global phenomenon.

Next to releasing singles and EP’s, Selekted Music developed multiple compilations concepts - one of them being the very first mix compilation of Avicii - and anthem songs for high profile events such as Dirty Dutch (by Chuckie), Amazone Project (by Sunnery James & Ryan Marciano), Fabulous (an Art of Dance concept) and F*** Me I’m Famous (by David Guetta).
profile_positions.title: Owner / Managing Director

profile_positions.description:
After one year of assisting the A&R department, I was promoted to Head of A&R. In this position, I was responsible for the exploitation of the master catalogue consisting of more than 3000 masters, the daily A&R, the product handling, developing new dance music related concepts, projects and labels, the promotion and marketing for over twenty Mid-Town Records labels such as Blue Records (Klubbheads, Lock 'n Load, Itty Bitty Boozy Woozy, The Ultimate Seduction, Club Caviar), Massive Drive (Three Drives, Mark Van Dale, Department1), Rotterdam Records (DJ Paul Elstak, Holy Noise, DJ Rob), Neophyte Records (Neophyte, Evil Activities, Tha Playah) and many more. I led a team of label managers, product managers, the design department, the recording studio and all assistants and interns. 

I oversaw all legal matters and licensing activities, varying from licensing out to international label partners and licensing in for in-house compilation albums and music DVD's for events such as Nightmare, Dance Valley, Ground Zero, Decibel, Project Hardcore, back2school and many more.
profile_positions.title: Head of A&R

profile_positions.description: After my years of soaking up the experience of working in a record store, I was promoted to A&R Manager to assist the Head of A&R. I became responsible for the daily demo handling, signing new artists, the creative guidance for the exclusively signed Mid-Town artists and producers, and handling all promotional and marketing activities for the weekly releases.
profile_positions.title: A&R Manager

profile_positions.description: Mid-Town Shops was the largest retailer in The Netherlands in the 90's and 00's for primarily house and dance music having nine stores, carrying a wide variety of dance vinyl (local releases as well as UK / USA / German / French / Italian imports), CD albums, CD compilations, music DVD's, merchandise and DJ gear. I was co-responsible for the Utrecht branch where I was handling sales and import buying.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Shop Manager
